definition: all/both/entirely/(used for emphasis) even/already/(not) at all

(after a verb or adjective) one who (is) .../(after a noun) person involved in .../-er/-ist/(used after a number or 後|后[hou4] or 前[qian2] to refer to sth mentioned previously)/(used after a term, to mark a pause before defining the term)/(old) (used at the end of a command)/(old) this
Chengdu subprovincial city and capital of Sichuan province 四川 in southwest China
Dadu, capital of China during the Yuan Dynasty (1280-1368), modern day Beijing
for the most part/on the whole/also pr. [da4 du1]

sentences.english: Many disaster will happen every day in the world.
sentences.chinese: 在這個世界上，天天都邑發生很多災難性的工作。

sentences.english: "More than any other subject, weight is delicate, " Maddison said.
sentences.chinese: “體重問題比其他問題都要微妙，”麥迪遜說。

sentences.english: The Browns are all college graduates.
sentences.chinese: 布朗一家人都是大學畢業生。

sentences.english: All these writers run to sentiment.
sentences.chinese: 所有這些作家都有傷感的傾向。

sentences.english: They all wore the most expensive clothes and had beautiful, long, curly hair.
sentences.chinese: 她們都穿着最昂貴的衣服，留着長長的美麗的鬈髮。

sentences.english: anywhere you want to go,  there's always somebody friendly.
sentences.chinese: 無論你想去哪兒，都會有些友好的人。

sentences.english: All of them insisted on my staying with them a few days longer.
sentences.chinese: 他們所有的人都堅持要我再跟他們多呆幾天時間。

sentences.english: The big boys jumped into the river but little Ned hung back.
sentences.chinese: 大些的男孩子都跳進河裏了，但小內德畏縮不前。

sentences.english: When I come to Shengzhou, I always stay there.
sentences.chinese: 我每次來嵊舟，都會待在那裏。

sentences.english: Bll the boys laughed to hear the good news.
sentences.chinese: 聽見這個好動靜然後，所有的男孩都笑了。

sentences.english: Standing on the starting line, we're all cowards.
sentences.chinese: 站在起跑線上，我們都是膽小者。

sentences.english: B:Here they are, will you weigh all our luggage together?
sentences.chinese: 這些都是，要不要把我的全部行李一起過磅？

sentences.english: None of this will actually be decided at Bali.
sentences.chinese: 所有這一切實際上都決定在巴里島。

sentences.english: A visit to one of these places is well worth while.
sentences.chinese: 這些地方的任何一處都是很值得一去的。

sentences.english: Most of the global companies are moving manufacturing facilities out-side of Japan.
sentences.chinese: 大多數跨國公司都在把生產設備遷出日本。

sentences.english: Eric Suen Yiu Wai and Chan Fa La felt embarrassed when they were playing heartbeat measurement.
sentences.chinese: 孫耀威和陳法拉玩量度心跳，都感尷尬。

definition: also/too/(in Classical Chinese) final particle implying affirmation
of/~'s (possessive particle)/(used after an attribute)/(used to form a nominal expression)/(used at the end of a declarative sentence for emphasis)

at once/right away/only/just (emphasis)/as early as/already/as soon as/then/in that case/as many as/even if/to approach/to move towards/to undertake/to engage in/to suffer/subjected to/to accomplish/to take advantage of/to go with (of foods)/with regard to/concerning
to watch from a height or distance/to survey
to link/to join/to connect/continuously/in succession/including/(used with 也[ye3], 都[dou1] etc) even/company (military)
this/these/(commonly pr. [zhei4] before a classifier, esp. in Beijing)
